title: Hatchy
author: Hatchy
content: Many of us have seen many reasons why Bitcoin is one of the best and rapidly growing technologies in the world today. Many Nigerians who have seized this great opportunity are testifying about how this technology has changed their lives in numerous ways. In our country today, with the rise of various online jobs, many people are sometimes confused about where to focus their efforts. The interesting part is that any online job within your reach can still offer you something valuable. The question now is how to find these opportunities. Some days ago, I encountered people who identified themselves as business strategists or affiliate marketers. They walked around, showcasing these business opportunities to anyone they came into contact with. This made me think it's a good way to help others discover available business ideas. Although I know that some might have ulterior motives, there are genuine opportunities out there.The idea is that many of us in this forum are familiar with Bitcoin and, as Bitcoin enthusiasts, we want the technology to be adopted worldwide, even in our country Nigeria. But how can we help promote Bitcoin to others and make them aware of it? I've heard of people in forums talking about how they added Bitcoin as a payment option for their businesses, seeing it as a way to promote Bitcoin. However, that alone isn't enough. Similar to those affiliate marketers, how many people have you shared your Bitcoin testimony with? How many people have you told about Bitcoin who have actually taken it seriously and shown interest in learning more? The goal is for each of us to play our part and make others aware of the technology behind Bitcoin and how it can help them. Bitcoin is not just a currency; it's a solution to many financial problems that people face in our country. If they can understand the technology, they can also enjoy its benefits, making everyone happy.So far, the few people I have taught about Bitcoin are happy to see that they made a profit from the recent bull run or increase in BITCOIN price and this has made them even more interested. Let's make an effort to occasionally tell people about Bitcoin. you never know how it might significantly improve their lives.

Those people that tell or teach them are the real bitcoin enthusiasts amongst others that are found in this crypto space. I have also heard of occasions where people do not want others to know that they’re into bitcoin because of the good and bad name attached to it, such people will not want to teach others and will want to be using in anonymously. Some say bitcoin is a scam and mostly a cover for illegal activities in the internet especially yahoo, while some have a notion that anyone that is into it is a millionaire. With this two mindsets people share about it, many people prefer to remain anonymous throughout their usage of it and I think it is okay for their own safety. So not all people can disseminate and invite people to learn about bitcoin without putting themselves into risk.

comments.author: adultcrypto
comments.body: Quote from: Hatchy on November 18, 2023, 09:20:13 PMSo far, the few people I have taught about Bitcoin are happy to see that they made a profit from the recent bull run or increase in BITCOIN price and this has made them even more interested. Let's make an effort to occasionally tell people about Bitcoin. you never know how it might significantly improve their lives.It's good you are able to share this wonderful development to others, that is really how we grow. I also love the fact that the people you introduced are able to experience good thing that can happen to people who embrace Bitcoin which is making more money. However, I will love to understand certain things about your approach since the topic is up for discussion. Are you teaching them Bitcoin trading or how to buy and hodl? You mentioned that they made profits and that sounds very much to me like short term trading. If that be the case, I have serious concerns. You will agree with me that Bitcoin trading is not something for Bitcoin newbies because the risk is extremely high. It only requires you going through the forum to read about the experience of others so you know the ultimate end of Bitcoin trading. Few wins might be like a bait to lure you in after which reality might dawn on you. I am not saying there are no successful Bitcoin traders. But for any single successful Bitcoin trader, you will see hundreds of people who lost money in Bitcoin. Therefore, instead of teaching people how to trade Bitcoin for quick profits, I will suggest you mentor them on how to buy and hodl to build their portfolio for a long term. This way, they will be relaxed even when bear market comes because they know it is a long term investment. This us just my opinion though.

comments.author: Justbillywitt
comments.body: Op With the way things are going in this country I don't think this you suggestion is a nice idea. Yes you have good intention to create more awareness about bitcoin but my brother in everything you are doing think about your safety first. The mentality of most of our country men and women are still very low when it comes to technology advancement. I think the high rate of illiteracy in the is a major factor that is contributing to this. Most of the youth you will meet out there to tell about bitcoin already knows about bitcoin, I know this because I have tried interviewing some good number of youths in my place of residence and a good number said they know about bitcoin but their major challenge is finance. And you know the high rate of unemployment in the country. So are you going to tell them to go and borrow money to invest in bitcoin? That one aside you that people who will readily have money to invest in bitcoin are the market men and women and majority of these people are illiterates, all they know is their business and are only interested in what they will invest today and see their profit tomorrow or a week later, so they won't even listen to you. And when you stress further it will be as if you have a special interest. Also you know that most of Nigerians pay much attention and listen to whatever our government says and the Nigerian government through the CBN has place a temporary ban on cryptocurrency trading and are blocking any account associated with crypto trading. So most Nigerians are still scared as they don't want their account closed. Also you know what happen to MBA Forex/Trading company, when the Nigerian government came for them and closed the company. Millions of Nigerians lost their hard earned money and there was no refund even as we speak. So Nigerians are skeptical when it comes to online investment as you know that bitcoin trading and investment is online. There awareness of bitcoin in Nigeria is already high, what we need now is just an enabling environment from the government and sensitizing the public that bitcoin investment is not a bad thing and it's welcome in the country and that no authority will come after you when you engage in bitcoin trading publicly or privately in the country. And also introduce bitcoin teaching in our educational curriculum for secondary and tertiary institutions, because that's where the youths are and those students can teach their parents at home about bitcoin. Parents and elderly ones will be more attentive and willing to learn when their children are the ones teaching them about bitcoin investment than a stranger they just meet on the street.
